intro: Seseli angustum, commonly known as narrowleaf seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is found in regions of western North America. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Seseli angustum is also noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
